definition: abbr. for the Big Dipper constellation 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1]
to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together
dry measure for grain equal to ten 升[sheng1] or one-tenth of a 石[dan4]/decaliter/peck/cup or dipper shaped object/old variant of 陡[dou3]
to lift/to raise/to raise one's head/high/high spirits/soaring/expensive
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate

sentences.english: I saw that he's mature and full of will, " Maradona said.
sentences.chinese: 我能看到他的成熟和斗志昂扬，”马拉多纳说。

sentences.english: She continued to work in a blithe spirit in spite of all difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 她不管多么艰难继续斗志昂扬地工作。

sentences.english: Looking back on yesterday youth and boosting high-spirited.
sentences.chinese: 回首昨日，青春激扬，斗志昂扬。

sentences.english: They knew of it and motivated by it.
sentences.chinese: 他们知道事业正义，并因此斗志昂扬。

sentences.english: They went with songs to the battle, they were young.
sentences.chinese: 他们奔向战场时哼着歌，年少力强，斗志昂扬。

definition: spirit trembling with excitement (idiom); in high spirits/lively and full of enthusiasm/full of energy/con brio
enormously proud of one's success (idiom); smug/complacent
head high, chest out (idiom); to keep up one's spirits/in fine mettle (of animal)
full of youthful energy (idiom); vigorous/energetic/a bright spark
to rouse to vigorous action/energetic mood
to be fired up (idiom)/to have one's blood racing
in high spirits (idiom); glowing with health and vigor
